timeZone.description:
Country time zone. Opsramp supports a comprehensive list of timezones.

Example: "timeZone": "America/Los_Angeles"

email.description: Email of the user. (Alert and report notifications are sent to the email address.)

country.description: Country name. To get the list of countries, use Get Countries API.

timeZone.description:
Time zone of the country. Use the Get Timezones API to get the list of timezones.

Example: "timeZone": { "code": "EST"}

userNotifications.description: (Optional) Email to which the alert and report notifications are sent.

roles.description: (Optional) Defines permission sets to user and user groups on devices and device groups. Assign roles to a user. See Search Roles API to get roles created under a partner or client.

userGroups.description: (Optional) Assign users to specific user groups. Provide name of the user group.Use Search User Groups API to get details of user groups.

password\t.description:
Password must have a minimum of 7 characters with at least:
- One number (0-9)
- One special character (#,!, $,*)
- One lowercase (a-z)
- One uppercase (A-Z) character

userGroupType.description:
(Optional) Assign users to all user groups, or specific users groups. A user can also be an individual user, NOT being part of any user group.
Supported Values: ALL, NONE
- If a user should be part of all user groups, provide userGroupType: ALL
- If a user should be part of a specific user group, provide user group name.
Example:"userGroups": [{ "name": "Luminalto Admins" }]
- If a user should NOT be part of any user group, provide userGroupType: NONE

email.description: Email of the user. (Alert and report notifications are sent to the email address.)

country.description: Country name. To get the list of countries, use Get Countries API.

timeZone.description:
Time zone of the country. Use the Get Timezones API to get the list of timezones.

Example: "timeZone": { "code": "EST"}

userNotifications.description: (Optional) Email to which the alert and report notifications are sent.

roles.description: (Optional) Defines permission sets to user and user groups on devices and device groups. Assign roles to a user. See Search Roles API to get roles created under a partner or client.

userGroups.description: (Optional) Assign users to specific user groups. Provide name of the user group.Use Search User Groups API to get details of user groups.

password\t.description:
Password must have a minimum of 7 characters with at least:
- One number (0-9)
- One special character (#,!, $,*)
- One lowercase (a-z)
- One uppercase (A-Z) character

userGroupType.description:
(Optional) Assign users to all user groups, or specific users groups. A user can also be an individual user, NOT being part of any user group.
Supported Values: ALL, NONE
- If a user should be part of all user groups, provide userGroupType: ALL
- If a user should be part of a specific user group, provide user group name.
Example:"userGroups": [{ "name": "Luminalto Admins" }]
- If a user should NOT be part of any user group, provide userGroupType: NONE

channel.title: channel
channel.description: Channel ID. To get list of available channels, access the Get Channels API.

country.description: Name of the country. To view a list of countries, access the Get Countries API.

rdp2swfState.description: A flag used that if rdp2swfState=true, converts remote console recordings to flash format.

enableCLIRecording.description: Set enableCLIRecording=true to enable CLI recording.

businessStartHour.description: Start of the business hour. The format is 24-hour clock notation. Example: 02, 15

businessEndHour.description: End of the business hour. The format is 24-hour clock notation. Example: 16, 20

businessDayStart.description: Start of the business day. Represented in numbers. Example: 2-Monday, 6-Friday

businessDayEnd.description: End of the business day. Represented in numbers. Example: 1-Sunday, 7-Saturday

remoteAccess.description:
Set as true to enable remote access module .

Note: This feature is enabled for clients only if remote access module is enabled at partner level.

smsVoiceNotification.description: Set as true to receive SMS Voice Notification .

name.description: Name of the Agent Policy. Set enable=true to enable policies.

nocDetails.description: NOC details. To get the list of available NOCs, access the Get Tenant NOCs API.

whiteListedIps.description:
IP whitelisting is a security feature often used for limiting and controlling access only to trusted users. IP whitelisting allows you to create lists of trusted IP addresses or IP ranges from which your users can access your domains.

Example: IP addresses can be of the form [172.22.22.*] or a range [172.22.2.{0-50}]

resourceDecommission.description: A resource can be decommissioned if you do not wish to manage the resource anymore. A resource moved into decommissioned state is not re-managed. Provide resourceDecommission: true to enable the module for a client. If you do not provide any value, the default value is false.

technologies.description: List of technologies of the given service.

technology.description: To get list of available technologies, use the `Get Alert Technologies` API.

ipAddress.description: IP address of the hosted system.

userName.description: User name required to access the hosted system.

port.description: Port number used to access the hosted system.

ipRange.description: Range of IP addresses used to access the hosted system.

addOns.description: (Optional) Client specific addOns as provided by OPSRAMP on specific packages Viz "SMS and Voice", "Knowledgebase Management", "OS Service Start/Stop Actions", "Remote Access Management", "Process Automation", "Extended Data Retention", "Mask Resource Identity Management", "Event Enrichment".

packages.description: (Optional) Client specific Packages as provided by OPSRAMP i..e Hybrid Discovery and Monitoring", "Event and Incident Management", "Remediation and Automation".

Country time zone. Opsramp supports a comprehensive list of timezones.

Example: "timeZone": "America/Los_Angeles"
